message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper deals with natural language processing tasks such as textual entailment and answer selection, which are typically studied in the subfield of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper proposes a novel architecture based on Gated Recurrent Unit (GRU) for identifying and pooling phrase alignments of different intensities, which involves representation learning and attention pooling, both of which are common techniques in machine learning and artificial intelligence (cs.AI, cs.LG). The paper also discusses the limitations of prior work in phrase generation and representation, alignment at word and phrase levels, and attention mechanisms, which are relevant to information retrieval (cs.IR) and neural networks (cs.NE).
